forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. West wind 13 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind 10 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, an enveloping cloak of gray clouds dominates the skyline, echoing the chill carried in by a steady westward wind. The temperature hovers around the mid-50s, and the city feels as though it’s wrapped in a soft blanket of fog, subtly obscuring the view but lending a certain mysterious charm. The remnants of the morning’s marine layer linger around the Golden Gate Bridge, creating an ethereal scene as the powerful winds brush against the city’s vibrant structures. The brisk air suggests a brisk walk down to the waterfront or perhaps a stop at one of the cozy cafés scattered throughout the neighborhoods—perfect spots to warm up with a hot drink while observing the world go by.

As twilight beckons, expect cooler temperatures sinking down to around 50 degrees, reinforcing the notion that layers are essential for comfort. A smart choice would be to don a light jacket over a sweater, allowing for some flex in case the cool breeze picks up. With the sky draped in clouds, the day’s pleasantness leans more towards introspection than outdoor adventures, inviting a stroll along the Embarcadero or a visit to a gallery tucked away from the elements. Today calls for a measured embrace of the city’s beautiful undercurrents, where moments of stillness can be as enriching as time spent under sunny skies.
